title: 16 NFC teams, 16 offseason awards: The good -- and most confusing -- additions
content: Green Bay has a wide receiver logjam. Washington loaded up on veterans. And San Francisco isn't quite ready to rebuild.

title: Ant vows: 'Nobody's going to work harder than me'
content: Timberwolves guard Anthony Edwards made a promise to improve after Minnesota fell short of the NBA Finals for the second straight year.

title: MLB purchasing equity stake in fledgling AUSL
content: MLB is purchasing an equity stake in the Athletes Unlimited Softball League, partnering with the fledgling league that is preparing for its first four-team season and plans to expand in future years.

title: Texas' Miller: No COVID year to hurt veteran depth
content: Texas coach Sean Miller says the lower number of players with an extra year from the COVID-19 eligibility rules will hurt college basketball next season.

title: Sinner beats Gasquet to end Frenchman's career
content: Jannik Sinner sent Frenchman Richard Gasquet into retirement Thursday with a 6-3, 6-0, 6-4 hammering at the French Open.

title: 'Laser focused' OKC races into 1st Finals since '12
content: The Thunder were "clicking on all cylinders" in Game 5, reeling off their fourth win of 30 or more points in the playoffs to oust the Timberwolves and reach the NBA Finals.

title: Panthers to Cup Final: 'This year, it's all business'
content: The Panthers advanced to their third straight Stanley Cup Final with a 5-3 victory over the Hurricanes in Game 5.

title: Fever fall without Clark: 'A kind of gut punch'
content: The Fever's first game without star Caitlin Clark was rockier than they'd hoped, as they lost to the Mystics on Wednesday night in Baltimore.

title: Adelman wants Nuggets in even better condition
content: New Nuggets coach David Adelman, who was officially introduced Wednesday, wants his team to be in even better condition and open to new ideas come training camp.

title: ðŸ“ˆ MLB Power Rankings: Another change at No. 1
content: Through the first two months of the 2025 season, five different teams have sat atop our list. Who won the battle in Week 9?

title: Why two top MLB prospects are still in the minors despite huge numbers
content: A pair of top prospects are tearing up the minors while the Red Sox and Royals are scuffling. What gives?

title: Storylines: Can Nelly Korda get back to winning? How will Erin Hills play?
content: The 80th U.S. Women's Open figures to be a tough test at Erin Hills Club. We break down some of the biggest things to watch ahead of the LPGA's second major of the year.

title: Which WNBA offseason moves are making the biggest impact -- and who still has work to do?
content: Kelsey Plum, Natasha Cloud and a Phoenix duo have made an immediate impact on their new WNBA teams in 2025.

title: Delayed flights, missed meals and little sleep: How college teams adjusted to cross-country travel
content: How Oregon State baseball and multiple teams at UCLA adapted to new schedules, for better and for worse.

title: How Indy is exploiting New York's defense, plus more intel from the East finals
content: What are scouts, execs and coaches saying about the Pacers, Knicks and the test facing either team in the Finals?

title: No Morgan, no Rapinoe: The USWNT doesn't have a face of the team now. Is that OK?
content: Since Alex Morgan retired, the USWNT has lacked a star leader. Is Trinity Rodman due for that role? Naomi Girma or someone else?

title: We want Ronaldo to sign new deal - Al Nassr chief
content: Al Nassr want to extend Cristiano Ronaldo's contract but face competition for the his signature, Fernando Hierro said on Thursday.

title: City chief wants to finish transfer business by CWC
content: Manchester City chairman Khaldoon Al Mubarak has said the club is aiming to complete its summer transfer business in time for the Club World Cup.

title: Sources: Chelsea near Delap deal as Utd miss out
content: Chelsea have beaten Manchester United to the Â£30 million signing of Liam Delap with sources telling ESPN, with a deal close to being finalised.

title: Bayern confirm Tah signing from Leverkusen
content: Bayern Munich strengthened their defense ahead of the Club World Cup by announcing the signing of Germany center back Jonathan Tah from Bundesliga rivals Bayer Leverkusen on Thursday.

title: Amad hopes Garnacho will stay at Man United
content: Amad Diallo said on Thursday that he hopes his Manchester United teammate Alejandro Garnacho will stay at the club amid growing speculation that he will leave in the summer.

title: Betis irked after Sevilla praise Maresca, Chelsea
content: Real Betis are annoyed by cross city rivals Sevilla's public praise of Enzo Maresca, who led Chelsea to the UEFA Conference League title on Wednesday.

title: Neymar to make decision on future after June 12
content: Neymar, who rejoined his boyhood club Santos in January on a five-month contract, becomes a free agent on June 30. The club are keen for him to stay.

title: Messi, SuÃ¡rez score 2 each in lopsided Miami win
content: Luis SuÃ¡rez and Lionel Messi each finished with two goals and an assist to lead host Inter Miami to a 4-2 victory over CF Montreal on Wednesday night in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

title: Bengals' Trey Hendrickson is 'extremely dug in' over contract dispute; here's what to know
content: Hendrickson said he won't play without a new contract, and mandatory minicamp is nearing. Will something give?

title: NBA draft withdrawal deadline: NIL's impact, Florida's gain, the 2026 draft, more
content: Who are biggest winners and losers from prospects' decisions to stay or go? We answer the burning questions.

title: 2025 MLB mock draft 1.0: High school slugger or college ace at No. 1?
content: Starting with a wide-open top of the board, here's how the first round of this July's draft could play out.

title: How PSG moved on from MbappÃ©, Messi and Neymar -- but got better
content: Paris Saint-Germain once had all the game's biggest stars, but always fell short of Champions League glory. In 2025, with a team of young talent and no major egos, they're poised to finally break through.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: 'Missile you mentioned ... ': China ducks questions on weapons used by Pak against India
content: China declined to comment on the effectiveness of its weapons used by Pakistan during recent clashes with India, including the PL-15E missile. A Chinese spokesperson urged restraint between the two nations, reiterating China's commitment to regional peace. This follows India's strikes on terror infrastructure in Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack. China remains Pakistan's primary arms supplier, providing advanced military equipment.

title: 'Before we could ... ': Pak PM admits India's BrahMos volley foiled offensive plans
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif admitted that Indian missiles, including BrahMos, struck multiple locations inside Pakistan, including Rawalpindi airport. Sharif recounted Pakistan's planned retaliation, which was preempted by further Indian strikes following Operation Sindoor. India has rejected dialogue overtures, insisting that talks can only occur when Pakistan ceases cross-border terrorism and vacates PoK.

title: Why US is 'aggressively' revoking visas of Chinese students
content: The Trump administration's plan to revoke visas for Chinese students, particularly those with ties to the Chinese Communist Party or studying in critical fields, has sparked widespread concern. This move, coupled with new export controls on semiconductor software, threatens to disrupt the fragile trade truce between the US and China.

title: 'Very dandy plan': Why US court nixed Trump tariffs
content: A US federal trade court has blocked President Trump's tariff deployment, stating he exceeded his authority by usurping powers vested in Congress. The court dismissed the administration's argument that tariffs were used to defuse the India-Pakistan conflict.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after it laid off over 2k software engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: From smile to shock: Preity Zinta's reaction goes viral as Punjab Kings collapse
content: Preity Zinta's initial cheer turned to concern as Punjab Kings endured a disastrous start against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in their IPL 2025 Qualifier 1 match. PBKS lost four crucial wickets within the Powerplay, including key players like Priyansh Arya and Prabhsimran Singh. Zinta's changing expressions mirrored the team's struggles as they reeled under pressure after the early collapse.

title: Trump vs Tech Bros: How Musk and Co learned they can't control him
content: Musk isnâ€™t the only one who thought he could contain Trump. Bezos tried dÃ©tente. Cook tried diplomacy. Zuckerberg tried appeasement. All of them believed they were in the room where it happened. But by mid-2025, it was painfully clear: Trump isnâ€™t an operator. Heâ€™s the transformation. And no one, not even the tech bros who helped bring him back, is immune.

title: â€˜Shameâ€™: BJP hits back at Mamata for 'belittling armed forces'
content: The BJP has strongly criticized West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for allegedly mocking 'Operation Sindoor,' labeling it a mere 'business of sindoor.' Amit Malviya accused Banerjee of belittling the sacrifices made in defense of India's security. Banerjee, in turn, accused PM Modi of politicizing the military action for political gain.

title: Sahil Lavingia who was fired from DOGE in 2 months: I reached out to ...
content: Sahil Lavingia's brief stint with DOGE, a task force aimed at cutting federal spending, ended abruptly after just two months. Hired to streamline veterans' services, Lavingia developed tools to identify wasteful contracts but faced bureaucratic hurdles. His candid interview about DOGE's limitations and lack of authority led to his swift dismissal, highlighting the challenges of implementing change within the government.

title: 'People of PoK our own, day not far when ...': Rajnath Singh's big claim
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, at the CII summit, asserted India's firm stance: dialogue with Pakistan will solely address terrorism and PoK. He emphasized PoK residents as integral to India, envisioning reunification. Singh highlighted India's evolved counter-terrorism strategy, stating Pakistan is paying a heavy price for sponsoring terror.

title: Virat Kohli explodes in celebration as Shreyas Iyer walks back cheaply
content: Virat Kohli's fervent celebrations were a highlight as Royal Challengers Bengaluru faced Punjab Kings in the IPL 2025 Qualifier 1. Josh Hazlewood's crucial early breakthrough, dismissing Shreyas Iyer, ignited Kohli's passionate reaction. RCB, after winning the toss and electing to bowl, included Hazlewood in place of Nuwan Thushara, while Punjab Kings brought in Azmatullah Omarzai.

title: Til death do us part: Why couples are killing instead of leaving partners
content: A disturbing trend of domestic murders is emerging across India in 2025, with wives and lovers turning into perpetrators. These gruesome acts, fueled by infidelity, emotional neglect, and a desire for control, often involve meticulous planning and a chilling lack of remorse. Experts emphasize the importance of early intervention, emotional control, and conflict resolution to prevent such tragedies.

title: Muskâ€™s 72-hour â€˜ultimatumâ€™ to Apple that may have put Cook in disagreement with his team
content: In 2022, Elon Musk issued a 72-hour ultimatum to Apple, demanding a $5 billion deal for SpaceX to become the exclusive satellite provider for iPhones. Apple rejected the offer, leading to a three-year conflict involving regulatory challenges and internal dissent within Apple regarding its satellite strategy. Despite the challenges and internal resistance, Apple has invested heavily in Globalstar, signaling its commitment to satellite connectivity.

title: 'Trade, tariff not discussed': India again refutes Trump's claim on ceasefire
content: India firmly rejected the Trump administration's claim that US trade incentives led to a ceasefire with Pakistan. The external affairs ministry clarified no trade discussions occurred and that the ceasefire resulted solely from direct military talks. External affairs minister Jaishankar had earlier credited military action, not US mediation, for ending hostilities, reiterating no third-party involvement in the decision.

title: 'Talks will be held when ... ': India rejects Pak PM's call for dialogue
content: India firmly stated that dialogue with Pakistan remains suspended until Islamabad takes concrete action against terrorism, following the Pahalgam attack. The Indus Waters Treaty is also on hold until Pakistan verifiably ceases cross-border terrorism support. This strong response follows Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif's offer for talks on Kashmir and counterterrorism, alongside trade promotion.

title: Trump admin gives Harvard 30 days to justify hosting international students
content: The Trump administration has threatened to withdraw Harvard University's right to host international students, citing alleged reporting violations and a failure to combat antisemitism. This action jeopardizes a court hearing related to the ban on new foreign student enrollment.

title: Why is Yuzvendra Chahal not playing in Qualifier 1?
content: Rajat Patidar, Royal Challengers Bengaluru captain, chose to bowl first after winning the toss against Punjab Kings in the IPL 2025 Qualifier 1. RCB replaced Nuwan Thushara with Josh Hazlewood, while Punjab Kings brought in Azmatullah Omarzai for Marco Jansen. Yuzvendra Chahal's absence from Punjab Kings' XI due to a minor niggle raised concerns despite earlier hopes for his recovery.

title: Why is Jitesh Sharma not leading RCB in Qualifier 1 vs Punjab Kings?
content: Rajat Patidar, back from injury, led Royal Challengers Bengaluru after winning the toss and choosing to field against Punjab Kings in the IPL 2025 Qualifier 1. RCB brought in Josh Hazlewood for Nuwan Thushara, while Punjab Kings replaced Marco Jansen with Azmatullah Omarzai. Jitesh Sharma, who captained RCB in Patidar's absence, returned to his wicket-keeping role. Why is Jitesh Sharma not leading RCB today?

title: Watch: Indian baraat takes over Wall Street
content: A 400-person Indian wedding procession took place on Wall Street this week. The baraat featured music, dancing, and traditional attire. The groom walked instead of riding a horse. The event stopped traffic and drew crowds. DJ AJ shared a video that went viral. Social media users reacted positively, celebrating the cultural fusion.

title: Yunus accuses India of destabilising B'desh: What MEA said
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has dismissed Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Mohammad Yunus's accusations of destabilization attempts. The MEA spokesperson suggested these claims are a deflection from internal issues, emphasizing the Bangladesh government's responsibility for law and order. Yunus had alleged Indian hegemony and conspiracies to undermine Bangladesh, while India is urging Bangladesh to hold inclusive and fair elections soon.

title: Draisaitl turns heads ahead of Game 5 as Oilers seek fourth straight win
content: Leon Draisaitl's arrival in Dallas for Game 5 has created excitement among Edmonton Oilers fans. Pictures of Draisaitl in a blue suit were shared online. Fans expressed their admiration for the player. The Oilers are set to face the Dallas Stars. Zach Hyman will miss the game due to injury. Coach Kris Knoblauch confirmed Hyman's season is likely over.

title: Man bites businessman's finger, surgery costs Rs 2 lakh
content: Bengaluru businessman Jayant Shekhar underwent surgery after a severe road rage incident on Magadi Road. It began when rainwater splashed onto another car, leading to a violent confrontation. Shekhar was assaulted, his finger bitten, and threatened. Police have registered a case and are searching for the suspects, who were in a car with registration number KA-02-MT-0512.

title: What happens if PBKS vs RCB Qualifier 1 gets washed out?
content: Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bengaluru are set to clash in a high-stakes playoff match at Mullanpur, vying for a spot in the IPL 2025 final. Weather forecasts predict partly cloudy skies with potential rain interruptions, possibly shortening the match. As per the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD), Mullanpur is expected to see partly cloudy skies with the possibility of one or two brief spells of rain or thundershowers in some areas.

title: Common herbal supplement linked to deadly liver disease
content: Turmeric, celebrated for its health benefits, faces scrutiny due to reports of liver damage linked to supplements, as highlighted by the Daily Mail. Robert Grafton experienced severe liver issues after using a turmeric-based liquid, containing 2,250 mg of curcumin. The Drug-Induced Liver Injury Network (DILIN) has identified multiple similar cases.

title: 'Why promise ... ': Air Chief's blunt warning over delays in defence projects
content: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh has voiced strong concerns over persistent delays in India's defence projects, urging accountability and timely delivery. He criticised unrealistic timelines in contracts and the defence forces' reluctance to address underperformance. In a rare moment of candour, the Air Chief also touched upon the culture of restraint within the defence forces, saying the services have often refrained from calling out underperformance explicitly.

title: 'Speaking like BJP chief, not a PM': Mamata's sharp attack and a dare for PM Modi
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee launched a strong counterattack against PM Modi, accusing him of politicising national security and undermining the opposition. Banerjee challenged the BJP to hold elections immediately, asserting Bengal's readiness. She criticised Modi for acting as a BJP president rather than a Prime Minister, especially during anti-terror efforts.

title: 'I am ready': Pujara on Gambhir's phone call for England tour
content: Following the retirements of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and Ravichandran Ashwin, and Mohammed Shami's injury, Shubman Gill will captain an inexperienced Indian Test team in England. Cheteshwar Pujara expressed his readiness for a return if selected. Rishabh Pant has been named vice-captain, while B Sai Sudharsan and Arshdeep Singh receive their first Test call-ups for the challenging series.

title: 'MPs, terrorists roaming freely ...': Cong sparks new row over delegations
content: A political firestorm erupted after Congress leader Jairam Ramesh likened the free movement of Pahalgam terrorists to Indian MPs traveling abroad, drawing sharp BJP criticism. Ramesh accused the government of targeting Congress while terrorists remain at large. The BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla accused Congress of echoing Pakistan's narrative and insulting India's army and diplomatic efforts.

title: â€˜Indian economy size more than half of US in PPP termsâ€™
content: NITI Aayog Vice-Chairman Suman Bery stated that India's economy is $15 trillion in PPP terms, over half the size of the US economy. He emphasized improving labor productivity, diversifying supply sources, and leveraging FTAs for economic growth.

title: Rare brain infection kills 8 in TN after a routine dental visit: Key details
content: A tragic incident in Tamil Nadu saw a routine dental treatment turn deadly due to a contaminated saline bottle. Researchers discovered a neuromelioidosis outbreak, caused by Burkholderia pseudomallei, after a clinic reused a saline solution opened with a periosteal elevator. Ten patients were infected, and eight died within 16 days.

title: India's defence exports set to rise after Op Sindoor: DRDO chief
content: Following Operation Sindoor, India anticipates a surge in defence exports as indigenous equipment gains recognition for its war-tested capabilities, DRDO Chairperson Samir V Kamat said. The Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA) program's newly approved execution model encourages private sector involvement in fighter aircraft development, aiming for prototype completion by 2034 and production by 2035.

title: Solar storms are killing Starlink satellites, making them re-enter Earth sooner
content: A NASA study reveals that increased solar activity, particularly during solar maximum, accelerates satellite re-entry due to heightened atmospheric drag. This phenomenon, impacting constellations like Starlink, poses operational challenges and environmental concerns as more satellites burn up, releasing materials into the atmosphere. The situation necessitates improved space traffic management and consideration of space weather in planning.

title: 'When they start a family': Taylor and Kelce rumored to be planning something big
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's relationship is reportedly getting serious, with talks of engagement on the horizon. Sources suggest Kelce may seek Swift's parents' blessing soon. However, Swift's absence at the American Music Awards 2025 sparked controversy, with fans alleging she was snubbed after failing to win any awards. Despite the AMA drama, the couple seems focused on their relationship.

title: Two men sentenced in US for smuggling plot that killed 4 Indian nationals
content: An international human smuggling operation led to a tragic outcome, as two men were sentenced in a Minnesota federal court for their involvement in the deaths of four Indian nationals, including two children, in January 2022. Harshkumar Ramanlal Patel received a 10-year prison sentence followed by deportation, while Steve Anthony Shand was sentenced to six years and six months.

title: Rift deepens? Cong cites Tharoorâ€™s own book 'Paradoxical Prime Minister' in fresh jibe
content: Shashi Tharoor faces internal criticism within the Congress party after remarks in Panama seemingly credited the Modi government with initiating cross-border strikes, contradicting his own previous writings. Fellow Congress members, including Pawan Khera and Udit Raj, have publicly rebuked Tharoor, citing his book and historical military actions to challenge his statements.

title: â€˜Resist threatsâ€¦â€™: What happens to India-US trade deal after Trump tariffs deemed invalid
content: Amidst a US trade court's rejection of Trump-era tariffs, the Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI) advises India to proceed cautiously in FTA talks with the US. The court's ruling, invalidating tariffs imposed without Congressional approval, raises concerns about the legality of past US trade measures.

title: Changed locations, suicide notes: How Mittal familyâ€™s final hours unfolded in Panchkula
content: Investigations into the Panchkula mass suicide case reveal the Mittal family initially planned to end their lives at Dr B R Ambedkar Bhawan before choosing Sector 27. CCTV footage confirmed their presence at the bhawan, but they later moved to Sector 27, where the tragic event occurred.

title: Lack of water at Karachi airport? Pak actor slams authorities in viral video
content: Pakistani actor Hina Bayat used social media to highlight a critical water shortage at Karachi's Jinnah International Airport on Youm-e-Takbir. She expressed disappointment that on a day of national celebration, basic amenities like water in airport restrooms were lacking. Bayat questioned the deterioration of essential systems and the neglect of existing infrastructure in favor of new projects.

title: 'Citizens warned against illegal travel agencies': Iran after 3 Indians go missing
content: Following the disappearance of three Indian citizens after traveling to Iran, the Iranian Embassy in India has cautioned Indian citizens against unauthorized travel agencies. The Indian Embassy in Tehran has urged Iranian authorities for an immediate investigation, while Iranian officials assured they are coordinating with judicial authorities and keeping the Indian Embassy informed.

title: BRS questions rationale behind escalating cost of Young India schools from â‚¹80-â‚¹200 crore
content: Party leaders Sabitha Indra Reddy, Vanidevi want to know the fate of existing schools once the proposed schools are set up

title: Kerala govt. bans fishing within 20-nautical mile radius of shipwreck, announces compensation for fishers
content: 6 kg of free rice and â‚¹1,000 a month to each affected fisher families in Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Alappuzha and Ernakulam districts. Chief Minister dismisses speculation that fish caught off the coast of Kerala was inedible

title: IMD issues alert as deep depression crosses West Bengal coast
content: Cyclonic system enters through Sagar Island-Raidighi corridor; fisherfolk warned, CM assures preparedness amid forecasts of heavy rainfall

title: Chief Minister puts Kerala in emergency disaster preparedness mode as monsoon intensifies
content: Government has requisitioned the Centre for at least nine National Disaster Response Force teams until the monsoon abates. The teams will be deployed in Idukki, Malappuram, Kasaragod, and ThrissurÂ

title: The Congress, and AAP â€˜betrayed Sikhs for decadesâ€™, says BJP
content: Ahead of the by-election to the Ludhiana West Assembly constituency slated for June 19, the BJP hopes to garner the support of Sikhs, and make its presence felt in Punjab

title: Final delimitation of Kochi Corporation divisions mostly sticks to draft notification
content: While only two divisions have been added, multiple new ones were created and some eliminated, with most boundaries undergoing a sea change and populations now ranging between 6,500 and 9,000

title: 15-day programme to educate farmers begins in State
content: Horticulture university Vice-Chancellor K. Gopal underscores the importance of reducing pesticide usage and promoting alternative biocontrol-based management

title: RRI team find new code for detecting hidden properties of exotic materials
content: Scientists have found a new way of spotting a property of topological space called â€˜topological invariantâ€™ in quantum materials

title: Delay in filing FIR in shipwreck case will hurt Stateâ€™s interest, says maritime law expert
content: V.J. Mathew, vice-president of the Indian Maritime Law Association and former chairman of the Kerala Maritime Board, says for any meaningful investigation to take place into the accident, the police have to first register an FIR

title: NGT warns Odisha officials of prosecution over waste management lapses in Bargarh
content: Eastern Zone Bench expresses displeasure over non-compliance with 2023 order; seeks explanation from State, Collector, and civic body within a month

title: Unusually high-speed winds over Kerala, a throwback to 2018
content: The wind speed on Thursday was approximately 20 m/s or 72 kmph, whereas the normal speed is 10-15 m/s. On August 14, 2018, a day before the major flood, the wind speed was about 20 m/s. Experts say prevailing conditions are conducive for a wet spell in the State

title: Gaurav Gogoi slams PM Modiâ€™s remarks on â€˜Chineseâ€™ features
content: Congress MP Gogoi urges Prime Minister to focus on India-China issues, warns against reinforcing stereotypes that fuel discrimination

title: Compensate fishers for loss of livelihood following shipwreck: fishersâ€™ forum
content: Kerala Matsyathozhilali Aikya Vedi says the State should prevail upon the Centre, international agencies and shipâ€™s owner firm to roll out measures to compensate fishers

title: Japan PM Exchange "Meaningful" Talks On Tariff Issue With Trump Over Phone
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said that he exchanged views on tariff issues with US President Donald Trump by phone on Thursday.

title: 100 Days In Office, Delhi Chief Minister's House Hunt Continues
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta is yet to be allotted official accommodation, despite completing 100 days in office on Friday, even as her recent visit to the iconic Sessions House sparked speculation of a suitable residence for the BJP leader.

title: Envoys Of 6 Nations, Including Turkey, Present Credentials To President Murmu
content: Envoys of six countries, including Turkiye and Bangladesh, on Thursday presented credentials to President Droupadi Murmu at the Rashtrapati Bhavan here.

title: Rain In Parts Of Delhi, Orange Alert For Thundershowers, Strong Winds Tonight
content: With rain lashing parts of the national capital, an orange alert has been issued for Thursday night predicting rain, thunderstorms, and gusty winds, the weather department said.

title: Footprints In The Sand: How Pagis' Unique Skill Helped Gujarat During Op Sindoor
content: They can identify the enemy just by seeing footprints in the white desert sand in Kutch and technical advancements may have been made, but security forces continue to depend on them for their expertise, including during Operation Sindoor.

title: "Looks Like They Went On A Hike": Meghalaya Chief Minister On Missing Couple
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma on Thursday said he is "personally monitoring" the administration and police's efforts to trace a newly married couple from Madhya Pradesh, who went missing in Cherrapunji a week ago.

title: Smell Of Change: Incense Industry On Path To A Child Labour-Free Future
content: Child labour in the incense manufacturing industry, a longstanding concern for India, is declining significantly and the sector is moving towards complete freedom from child labour in Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, and Bihar, a study finds.

title: Water Metro In Mumbai, Other Places Soon? What Head Of Kochi Project Said
content: The Water Metro in Kochi has been successful and the Centre is now planning to start the ferry transportation system in 21 other places, the project's Managing Director Loknath Behera has said.

title: Bhuwan Ribhu Becomes First Indian Lawyer To Receive World Law Congress Honour For Child Rights
content: For over two decades, Bhuwan Ribhu's legal fight against child exploitation earned him the World Jurist Association's Medal of Honour

title: Opinion: Opinion | How Op Sindoor Has Laid Bare The Ideological Battle Brewing In Congress
content: Today, the contrasting positions taken by Rahul and team and dyed-in-the-wool Nehruvians such as Tharoor, Tewari and Sharma on Operation Sindoor are essentially an extension of the rebellion the G-23 group of leaders had waged in 2020.

title: "Leading In Agriculture Development": PM Modi At Sikkim's 50th Celebration
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday called Sikkim a pride of the country and said the Centre seeks to make the northeastern state a global tourism destination.

title: British Influenced Indian History, Jodha-Akbar Marriage Story Lie: Rajasthan Governor
content: Rajasthan Governor Haribhau Bagade claimed that several inaccuracies have been recorded in Indian history due to the early influence of British historians, including the widely cited story of the marriage of Jodha Bai and Mughal emperor Akbar.

title: PM Modi Inaugurates Rs 1,200 Crore New Terminal At Patna Airport
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated the new terminal building of the Patna Airport and laid the foundation stone for a new civil enclave at the Bihta airport on the outskirts of the city.

title: Scientists Warn Heat Waves To Last Longer, Affect More Areas In India
content: Heat waves in India are expected to last longer and affect larger regions, scientists have warned, as climate change continues to intensify extreme weather events.

title: Many Muslim Workers Quit Karnataka Congress Over Mangaluru Murder
content: Hundreds of Congress workers belonging to the Muslim community resigned en masse today in Mangaluru, in protest against the murders of young men from the community in the coastal region.

title: "Sometimes Unachievable, But We Sign Contract Anyway": Air Chief's Bombshell
content: India's Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh has raised concerns over delays in major defence procurement projects.

title: Thane Man Arrested For Spying For Pakistan, Shared Key Info With Intel Agent
content: The Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) of Maharashtra Police has arrested a resident of neighbouring Thane for allegedly spying for Pakistan, a senior official said on Thursday.

title: "Mini-Library" At Manipur Relief Camp A Huge Success Story Of Youth Power
content: A group of young people installed three metal shelves filled with some books at a relief camp in Manipur in July 2024. They called it a "mini library".

title: "Not Dilli, Not Pindi, Bangladesh First": BNP's Regional Policy Stance
content: The BNP, led by Acting Chairperson Tarique Rahman, is emphasising the need for elections and reforms, questioning Yunus's mandate to make long-term foreign policy decisions.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool join race for â‚¬100 million Ekitike
content: The race to acquire Hugo Ekitike has begun, with Liverpool and Chelsea set to fight for his signature.

title: Norris' win in Monaco has reset F1, McLaren title fight
content: Preseason title favorite Lando Norris was losing steam to teammate Oscar Piastri. That's no longer the case.

title: Ohtani scores 170 runs? Royals have a top-10 starting pitcher? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Rankings: Napheesa Collier jumps Caitlin Clark
content: Fantasy women's basketball rankings for 2025 with A'ja Wilson, Napheesa Collier and Caitlin Clark as the top three.

title: Expert picks and best bets: Can Barber extend her win streak vs. Blanchfield?
content: Retired MMA fighters Din Thomas and Anthony Smith make their predictions for the main event of the upcoming UFC Fight Night.

title: EA Sports College Football 26 gameplay officially revealed in new trailer
content: The latest entry in the revived series will include thousands of real college players and over 300 real-world coaches.

title: Dr. Guduru Jagadish is new director of BIRRD hospital
content: For a long time the the Balaji Institute of Surgery, Research, and Rehabilitation for the Disabled hospital was being run without a full-time director, affecting medical services

title: With expenditure rising and revenue dwindling, Bharathidasan University staring at funds crunch
content: The university requires â‚¹6.5 crore to â‚¹8 crore every month for meeting its salary obligations and dwindling resources are a source of worry for the management

title: Bhadra creating history by penning down Pravesanotsavam song
content: Mazha meghangal panthal orukkiya puthu varsham... penned by Bhadra Hari is the Pravesanotsavam song this year

title: Former Agriculture dept. official acquitted after 25 years of litigation
content: L. Laila, 69, faced allegations of misappropriating â‚¹3.47 lakh in government funds through forgery during her tenure as Assistant Director, Piravom, from 1993 to 1996

title: Thrissur Corporation cracks down on unsafe buildings
content: Despite being issued multiple warnings, several building owners have not complied with safety norms, prompting the corporation to act. Out of 227 identified old buildings, decisions have already been made regarding 144, says Mayor.

title: UDF, BJP slam final delimitation notification for Kochi Corporation
content: They claim that officials owing allegiance to the CPI(M) have rearranged and redrawn divisions in violation of the norms prescribed by the Delimitation Commission

title: Govt. targets to install 20 lakh rooftop solar units this year and three lakh units by June-end, says A.P. Chief Secretary Vijayanand
content: He stresses the need for providing wide publicity to the PM Surya Ghar scheme among the SC, ST and BC households

title: Arrangements in full swing for Pravesanotsavam: Minister
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to inaugurate Pravesanotsavam at Government Higher Secondary School, Kalavoor, Alappuzha

title: Factor in UGC norms, court rulings while amending anti-ragging rules: Kerala HC
content: There are constraints in initiating criminal action against ragging as per current norms, observes court

title: Telangana CID nabs two more in connection with inter-State organ trafficking case

title: New U.S. student visa norms unjust, seek central intervention, CPI(M) urges Naidu
content: Scrutinising social media posts and granting visas based on them is discriminatory and causes serious harm to students applying from India, of whom A.P. candidates constitute a significant number, says party State secretary V. Srinivasa Rao

title: New graduates can now intern with Nellore Collectorate
content: The District Collector announces a three to six months internship programme for fresh graduates and final year students who are motivated to step into public administration; last date to apply is 15 June

title: LDF govt. trying to mislead people on wildlife issue: Kerala Congress
content: The Cabinetâ€™s decision to seek Centreâ€™s approval to cull wild animals posing threat to human life an property is aimed at Nilambur byelection. The current legal framework empowers States to take action on such issues, says K. Francis George

title: PM Modi holds roadshow in Patna, meets BJP leaders ahead of upcoming polls

title: Panel on Centre-State relations to have a camp office in Delhi

title: 16,250 tenant farmers to get Crop Cultivators Rights Cards

title: Tiruchi Corporation plans to involve SHGs and NGOs in renovation and upkeep of public toilets
content: The civic proposes to drill borewells and install water tanks to ensure round-the-clock water supply and replace the damaged urinals and washbasins in all public toilets

title: Survey in progress to identify reasons for voter apathy among youth

title: From watermelon fields to NASCAR fame: The unstoppable rise of Ross Chastain
content: the TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide . from running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents . the desk is adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary .

title: Globally, 2.9k objects were placed in orbit in 2024; 3.6k added to debris
content: As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, its rolling out reels and reels of tales. If the first post office or a telephone connection paints one colour, the Stamp of a stock market scam or the â€˜Jewel Thievesâ€™ scandal paint yet another colour. If failure of a sounding rocket was a stepping stone, sending 104 satellites in one go was a podium. If farmer suicides are a bad climax, growing number of Unicorns are a grand entry. Chethan Kumar, Senior Assistant Editor, The Times of India, who alternates between the mundane goings-on of the hoi polloi and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and Jawans, feels: Thereâ€™s always a story, one just has to find it. Read More

title: Ranking every treble-winning team: Can PSG join BarÃ§a, Bayern, City, United on list?

title: Stars-Oilers Game 5 preview: Can Dallas extend the series?
content: the Edmonton Oilers have opened up a 3-1 lead over the Stars in the Western Conference finals . the Oilers' odds to win the finals are now +600, up from +280 when the series was 2-1 .

title: Valkyries coach Natalie Nakase making history in the WNBA
content: the WNBA's first expansion team in 17 years, the Golden State Valkyries made their own mark in the history books . at just over 5-foot-1, she is not the prototypical basketball player or coach . she began her career as a walk-on guard at UCLA, eventually earning the starting job her junior year and becoming team captain .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Notre Dame pushes closer to the top spot
content: Notre Dame has pushed its way into the no. 2 slot of our 2026 class rankings . the Fighting Illini shook off the loss of ESPN 300 CB Victor Singleton quite well . Nasir Rankin , a top-10 athlete in the ESPN 300, is an early in-state priority .

title: MAC preview: Ohio will need to fend off Toledo, Buffalo as it looks for repeat
content: a big tent can produce occasionally incredible things . the idea of a so-called "super league" continues to waft around . in the past 25 seasons, MAC teams have scored 78 wins over power-conference teams .

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Thunder dominate Wolves in Game 5
content: the Thunder beat the Timberwolves to reach the 2025 NBA conference finals . the new york Knicks and Indiana Pacers are potentially a game away from wrapping up their series . but the Thunder bounced back to win Game 4 in a back-and-forth battle before winning the series in dominant fashion .

title: The five most astounding stats behind the 100-game stretch when the Tigers have ruled MLB
content: the Detroit Tigers were 55-63, 10 games out of the third wild-card spot . they had dealt starting pitcher Jack Flaherty at the trade deadline . their lineup in a 3-1 loss to the San Francisco Giants featured Akil Baddoo batting leadoff (hitting .125), Gio Urshela at cleanup (.605 OPS) and Bligh Madris playing first base .

title: Previewing the WCWS: Strengths, (relative) weaknesses for every team
content: the 2025 NCAA softball tournament's overall no. 1 seed (Texas A&M) was knocked out before the super regionals . three unseeded teams took top-7 seeds to a third game . both teams lost Game 1 and were in serious trouble late in Game 2 .

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship begins on friday . Vanderbilt, which just won the tournament, is the no. 1 overall seed . the rest of the top eight national seeds are Texas at No. 2, Arkansas at no. 3, Auburn at no . 4, North Carolina at no no. 5, LSU at no 6 and Oregon State at no 8 .

title: Player survey: Who's the most underrated prospect in this class?
content: college basketball insider Jeff Borzello joined draft analysts Jeremy Woo and Jonathan Givony at the draft combine in Chicago earlier this month . a small handful received multiple votes, some were named by college teammates, some made the case for themselves and others insisted players featured in ESPN's latest mock draft were still underrated .

title: NHL free agency big board: Where does Marner land? Who are the other top options?
content: the salary cap is projected to rise to $95.5 million next season; $104 million in 2026-27 . it could lead to more teams comfortably retaining their own players on expiring contracts . the unrestricted free agent field is organized into different tiers .

title: Free agency and draft plans for Hurricanes, every other eliminated team
content: the 2024-25 NHL regular season is over and the playoffs are underway . a breakdown of the biggest keys this offseason and realistic expectations for next season . each eliminated team will try to add via free agency, trades and the draft .
